<details>
<summary>Additional Comments (1)</summary>

**`.github/workflows/ci.yml`**
[P1] `checks-windows` job uses `shell: bash` but still runs `which node`, which is typically not available in Git Bash on Windows (it’s a Unix tool, not a built-in). This can fail the Windows CI before tests/builds run.

Consider switching this to `command -v node` (in bash) or `where node` (in pwsh/cmd) to align with the intent of this PR.

Also appears in `.github/workflows/ci.yml` at `checks` install step (line ~161) and `checks-macos` install step (line ~355) if those runners ever lack `which`.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: .github/workflows/ci.yml
Line: 277:285

Comment:

Consider switching this to `command -v node` (in bash) or `where node` (in pwsh/cmd) to align with the intent of this PR.

Also appears in `.github/workflows/ci.yml` at `checks` install step (line ~161) and `checks-macos` install step (line ~355) if those runners ever lack `which`.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
